questions.question:
What will happen when you attempt to run the following code?

print(Hello, World!)
options: The code will raise the SyntaxError exception
The code will print Hello, World! to the console
The code will raise the TypeError exception
The code will raise the ValueError exception
The code will raise the AttributeError exception
questions.answer: The code will raise the SyntaxError exception
questions.subject: Error Handling

x = x + y
y += 1
print(x, y)

test(2, 1)

questions.question:
Take a look at the snippet,and choose the true statements:

nums = [1, 2, 3]
vals = nums
del vals[1:2]
options: nums and vals are of the same length
nums and vals refer to the same list
nums is no longer than vals
questions.answer:
nums and vals are of the same length
nums and vals refer to the same list

options: The program will raise an exception handled by the first except block
The program will cause a ValueError exception and output the following messag'Too bad..'
The program will cause a ValueError exception and output a default error message

The program will raise an exception handled by the second except block
questions.answer: The program will raise an exception handled by the first except block
